page.title: 01Farmland east of Drayton
page.content: The fringe of Market Drayton is largely modern owner occupied housing of professional and white collar commuters. The Grove School 1440 pupils is Shropshire's largest and with nearly 160 employees important to the town. The Shropshire Union Canal crosses the Tern Valley on a 60' embankment. It has two marinas offering boat hire and supplies to holidaymakers. A cricket/hockey ground and squash club are in Betton Road. The landscape is well tended rolling pastures, the fields larger than 50 years ago, but not prairies. Cattle and some sheep are the major occupation. Broomhall Grange is a trout farm.
